intro: Wahlenbergia diversifolia, commonly known as the Variable bellflower, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It has linear to lance-shaped leaves and produces small, showy blooms throughout the growing season. Wahlenbergia diversifolia is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and rockeries.
